info.title: Aviationstack API
info.description: The Aviationstack API was built to provide a simple way of accessing global aviation data for real-time, historical flights, and future flights as well as allow customers to tap into an extensive data set of airline routes and other up-to-date aviation-related information. Requests to the REST API are made using a straightforward HTTP GET URL structure and responses are provided in lightweight JSON format.

get.description: The Flights endpoint is capable of tracking flights and retrieving flight status information in real-time. In order to look up real-time information about one or multiple flights, you can use the API's Flights endpoint together with optional parameters to filter your result set.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Your API access key (find in your Aviationstack dashboard).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default 100. Maximum depends on plan (100 below Professional; 1000 on and above Professional). See docs for exact limits. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset. Use with `limit` for paging through results.

parameters.name: flight_date
parameters.description:
Historical flight date in YYYY-MM-DD format. 

**Note:** Aviationstack provides historical data for the last 3 months only.

**Note:** The API response returned for historical flights is identical to the API response returned for real-time flight data. To see the API response, please jump to the Real-Time Flights section.

parameters.name: flight_status
parameters.description: Filter by flight status; allowed values: scheduled, active, landed, cancelled, incident, diverted.

parameters.name: dep_iata
parameters.description: Filter by departure IATA code (e.g., SFO).

parameters.name: arr_iata
parameters.description: Filter by arrival IATA code (e.g., DFW).

parameters.name: dep_icao
parameters.description: Filter by departure ICAO code (e.g., KSFO).

parameters.name: arr_icao
parameters.description: Filter by arrival ICAO code (e.g., KDFW).

parameters.name: airline_name
parameters.description: Filter by airline name.

parameters.name: airline_iata
parameters.description: Filter by airline IATA code.

parameters.name: airline_icao
parameters.description: Filter by airline ICAO code.

parameters.name: flight_num
parameters.description: Filter by flight number (numeric or string).

parameters.name: flight_iata
parameters.description: Filter by flight IATA (e.g., AA1004).

parameters.name: flight_icao
parameters.description: Filter by flight ICAO (e.g., AAL1004).

parameters.name: min_delay_dep
parameters.description: Filter by minimum departure delay (minutes).

parameters.name: min_delay_arr
parameters.description: Filter by minimum arrival delay (minutes).

parameters.name: max_delay_dep
parameters.description: Filter by maximum departure delay (minutes).

parameters.name: max_delay_arr
parameters.description: Filter by maximum arrival delay (minutes).

parameters.name: arr_scheduled_time_arr
parameters.description: Filter flights by arrival scheduled date (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: dep_scheduled_time_dep
parameters.description: Filter flights by departure scheduled date (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional JSONP callback function name; if provided, response is wrapped for JSONP.

count.description: Number of returned results on this page.

total.description: Total number of results matching the query.

airline_id.description: Internal airline id (present on some responses).

hub_code.description: Hub code associated with the airline.

is_ground.description: Is the aircraft on the ground?

context.description: For validation errors, a context object with per-field entries.

get.description: The Aviationstack API is capable of providing data about airline routes, updated every 24 hours. In order to get airline route data, use the API's Routes endpoint along with a series of optional parameters to filter results.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Your API access key (find in your Aviationstack dashboard).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default 100. Maximum depends on plan (100 below Professional; 1000 on and above Professional). See docs for exact limits. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset. Use with `limit` for paging through results.

parameters.description: Filter by departure IATA code (e.g., SFO).

parameters.description: Filter by airline IATA code.

parameters.name: airline_icao
parameters.description: Filter by airline ICAO code.

parameters.name: flight_num
parameters.description: Filter by flight number (numeric or string).

parameters.description: Optional JSONP callback function name; if provided, response is wrapped for JSONP.

get.description: To get data about global airports, you can use the API's Airports endpoint. Customers subscribed to the Basic Plan or higher may also make use of the `search` request parameter to get airport autocomplete suggestions. Using Airports endpoint, you can get the list of Airports with information like location, IATA code, etc.

get.description: To get data about different airlines, you can use the API's Airlines endpoint. Only paid plan subscribers can use the `search` request parameter to receive airplane autocomplete suggestions. Using Airlines endpoint, you can get the data of Airlines like IATA code, callsign, status, etc.

get.description: To get data about different airplanes/aircrafts, you can use the API's Airplanes endpoint. Only paid plan subscribers can use the `search` request parameter to receive airplane autocomplete suggestions. Using Airplanes endpoint, you can get the information about Airplanes like Registration number, Production line, etc.

get.description:
The Flight Schedules endpoint is for retrieving real-time timetable information for flights on the current day. This endpoint is designed to give users detailed and up-to-date information about flight schedules, including departures and arrivals.

Simply attach the `iataCode` and `type` parameters to your API request URL.   

**Note:** *The `/timetable` and `/flightsfuture` endpoints have rate limits of 1 request every 10 seconds for Paid Plans and 1 request every 60 seconds for Free Plans, and exceeding these limits may result in throttling.*

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Your API access key (find in your Aviationstack dashboard).

parameters.name: iataCode
parameters.description: Airport IATA code (e.g., JFK, DXB). Required for timetable and flightsFuture endpoints.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Schedule type: arrival or departure (required for timetable and flightsFuture).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by flight status (timetable endpoint).

parameters.name: dep_terminal
parameters.description: Filter by departure terminal (e.g., 'I').

parameters.name: dep_delay
parameters.description: Filter by departure delay (minutes).

parameters.name: dep_schTime
parameters.description: Filter by exact departure scheduled time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: dep_estTime
parameters.description: Filter by exact departure estimated time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: dep_actTime
parameters.description: Filter by exact departure actual time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: dep_estRunway
parameters.description: Filter by exact departure estimated runway time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: dep_actRunway
parameters.description: Filter by exact departure actual runway time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: arr_terminal
parameters.description: Filter by arrival terminal (e.g., 'I').

parameters.name: arr_delay
parameters.description: Filter by arrival delay (minutes).

parameters.name: arr_schTime
parameters.description: Filter by exact arrival scheduled time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: arr_estTime
parameters.description: Filter by exact arrival estimated time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: arr_actTime
parameters.description: Filter by exact arrival actual time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: arr_estRunway
parameters.description: Filter by exact arrival estimated runway time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: arr_actRunway
parameters.description: Filter by exact arrival actual runway time (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: airline_name
parameters.description: Filter by airline name.

parameters.name: airline_iata
parameters.description: Filter by airline IATA code.

parameters.name: airline_icao
parameters.description: Filter by airline ICAO code.

parameters.name: flight_num
parameters.description: Filter by flight number (example 171).

parameters.name: flight_iata
parameters.description: Filter by flight IATA (e.g., AA1004).

parameters.name: flight_icao
parameters.description: Filter by flight ICAO (e.g., AAL1004).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default 100. Maximum depends on plan (100 below Professional; 1000 on and above Professional). See docs for exact limits. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset. Use with `limit` for paging through results.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional JSONP callback function name; if provided, response is wrapped for JSONP.

count.description: Number of returned results on this page.

total.description: Total number of results matching the query.

items.description: A single flight schedule entry (arrival or departure).

type.description: Type of timetable entry: arrival or departure.

context.description: For validation errors, a context object with per-field entries.

get.description:
The `flightsFuture` endpoint retrieves detailed flight schedule information, including departures and arrivals, for dates more than 7 days after the current date (e.g., if today is 2025-08-22, the requested date must be after 2025-08-29).

Simply attach the `iataCode`, `type`, `date` parameters to your API request URL. Set any date to future in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.     


**Note:** *Flight blocks within a codeshared block take precedence over those outside it for filtering purposes. So, if there is a flight block inside codeshared, then it will search the query param to match in this `codeshared>flight>iataNumber`. If codeshared block is not present then it will refer to the `flight>iataNumber`.*   

**Note:** *The `/timetable` and `/flightsfuture` endpoints have rate limits of 1 request every 10 seconds for Paid Plans and 1 request every 60 seconds for Free Plans, and exceeding these limits may result in throttling. Also, we don’t include very low-traffic airports—like CDT, which has around 10 or fewer flights per day—in our feeds.*.

parameters.name: access_key
parameters.description: Your API access key (find in your Aviationstack dashboard).

parameters.name: iataCode
parameters.description: Airport IATA code (e.g., JFK, DXB). Required for timetable and flightsFuture endpoints.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Schedule type: arrival or departure (required for timetable and flightsFuture).

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date for future flights (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: airline_iata
parameters.description: Filter by airline IATA code.

parameters.name: airline_icao
parameters.description: Filter by airline ICAO code.

parameters.name: flight_num
parameters.description: Filter by flight number (numeric or string).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default 100. Maximum depends on plan (100 below Professional; 1000 on and above Professional). See docs for exact limits. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset. Use with `limit` for paging through results.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Optional JSONP callback function name; if provided, response is wrapped for JSONP.

count.description: Number of returned results on this page.

total.description: Total number of results matching the query.

items.description: A single scheduled future flight entry.

weekday.description: Day of the week for the scheduled flight (1=Monday, 7=Sunday).

context.description: For validation errors, a context object with per-field entries.
